title: 2011 Danish Cup Final
text:
The 2011 Danish Cup Final was a <a href="association%20football">football</a> match that decided the winner of the <a href="2010%E2%80%9311%20Danish%20Cup">2010–11 Danish Cup</a>. It was played on 22 May 2011 at 18:45 <a href="Central%20European%20Summer%20Time">CEST</a>, between <a href="FC%20Nordsj%C3%A6lland">FC Nordsjælland</a> and <a href="FC%20Midtjylland">FC Midtjylland</a>, the same two teams who competed in <a href="2010%20Danish%20Cup%20Final">last year's final</a>, with FC Nordsjælland emerging victorious once again, 3–2.
Route to the final.
As both teams had finished between 5th and 10th in the <a href="2009%E2%80%9310%20Danish%20Superliga">previous season's Superliga</a>, both teams entered in the second round of the competition.
Pre-match.
Traditionally, the Danish Cup Final is played on <a href="Ascension%20Day">Ascension Day</a>, a <a href="public%20holidays%20in%20Denmark">public holiday in Denmark</a>, but the date 2 June was occupied by an international match date. Furthermore, the new match date of 22 May, set by the <a href="Danish%20FA">Danish FA</a> and accepted by the Superliga clubs, coincided with the 2011 <a href="Copenhagen%20Marathon">Copenhagen Marathon</a> which meant that the area surrounding <a href="Parken%20Stadium">Parken</a> was closed until 15:00, forcing the later starting time of 18:00.
For the first time in Danish Cup history, the same two teams were to play the final two years in a row, Nordsjælland beat Midtjylland 2–0 <a href="after%20extra%20time">after extra time</a> in <a href="2010%20Danish%20Cup%20Final">last year's final</a>.
Match.
The match was originally scheduled for 18:00 CEST, but 30 minutes prior to kick-off the match was postponed 45 minutes because of a risk of lightning.
Match details.
FC Nordsjælland was the designated home team for the match.
Statistics.
Overall
